de.hshn.mi.pdbg.basicservice

Interface BasicDBService


  • public interface BasicDBService
    BasicDBService defines methods in order to create persistable objects and also to store, fetch and delete such objects from a persistent store. The related objects must be instances of the interfaces HospitalStay, Patient or Ward.

    This service mainly supports four types of methods:

    1. The methods named create...() creates persistable objects. Note well that the objects are not yet persistent after this step.
    2. The method store(PersistentObject) stores newly created objects or updates persistent objects in the persistence store. Note well that the object is persistent after this step (objectID set), and not only its data is in the persistence store.
    3. Methods named remove...() remove objects from the persistence store.
    4. Methods named get...() can be used to retrieve objects from the persistence store.

      • createPatient

        Patient createPatient(String lastname,
                      String firstname)
        Parameters:
        lastname - must not be null and must not be ""
        firstname - must not be null and must not be ""
        Returns:
        A Patient object.
        Throws:
        AssertionError - Thrown if a given parameter value is invalid.

        Parameters:
        name - must not be null and must not be ""
        numberOfBeds - must not be negative
        Returns:
        A Ward object.
        Throws:
        AssertionError - Thrown if a given parameter value is invalid.

                                Ward s,
                                Date admissionDate)

        s - must not be null.
        admissionDate - must must not be null.
        Returns:
        A HospitalStay object.

      • removeHospitalStay

        void removeHospitalStay(long hospitalStayID)
        Removes a hospital stay from the database.
        Parameters:
        hospitalStayID - the object id of the stay to be removed. It must be greater than zero (0). It must not be PersistentObject.INVALID_OBJECT_ID
        Throws:
        AssertionError - Thrown if a given parameter value is invalid.
        StoreException - Thrown if an error occurred while removing the object.

      • getPatients

        List<Patient> getPatients(String lastname,
                          String firstname,
                          Date startDate,
                          Date endDate)
        Returns a list of Patient objects that match a set of search criteria. When searching via first name and last name, one may use the SQL wildcards ("%", "*", "_") in the search string.

        startDate and endDate define a period in which the patient was born.

        A null value for one of these parameters indicates that the related search criterion will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        lastname - May be null. If so, the value will be ignored as a search criterion.
        firstname - May be null. If so, the value will be ignored as a search criterion.
        startDate - The start date of the time period considered for valid patient birth dates during search. Every patient born after or at this date is considered for the search result. The value may be null. If so, there is no lower bound for valid birth dates during search.
        endDate - The end date of the time period considered for valid patient birth dates during search. Every patient born before or at this date is considered for the search result. The value may be null. If so, there is no upper bound for valid birth dates during search.
        Returns:
        A list of matching Patient objects is returned. It may be empty.
        Throws:
        FetchException - Thrown if an error occurred while fetching objects.

      • getPatient

        Patient getPatient(long patientID)
        Parameters:
        patientID - The identifier (objectID) of the object to be fetched. It must be greater than zero (0). It must not be PersistentObject.INVALID_OBJECT_ID
        Returns:
        The Patient object or null, if none was found with the given patientID.
        Throws:
        FetchException - Thrown if an error occurred while fetching an object.
        AssertionError - Thrown if a given parameter value is invalid.

      • getWards

        List<Ward> getWards()
        Returns:
        All available wards. If no wards could be found, an empty list is returned.
        Throws:
        FetchException - Thrown if an error occurred while fetching objects.

      • getWard

        Ward getWard(long wardID)
        Parameters:
        wardID - The identifier (objectID) of the object to be returned. It must be greater than zero (0). It must not be PersistentObject.INVALID_OBJECT_ID
        Returns:
        The Ward object or null, if none was found with the given wardID.
        Throws:
        FetchException - Thrown if an error occurred while fetching an object.
        AssertionError - Thrown if a given parameter value is invalid.

      • getHospitalStays

        List<HospitalStay> getHospitalStays(long patientID)
        Parameters:
        patientID - The identifier (objectID) of the patient for which the stays will be fetched. It must be greater than zero ( 0 ). It must not be PersistentObject.INVALID_OBJECT_ID
        Returns:
        A list of matching HospitalStay objects is returned. It may be empty.
        Throws:
        FetchException - Thrown if an error occurred while fetching objects.
        AssertionError - Thrown if a given parameter value is invalid.
        See Also:
        HospitalStay

      • getHospitalStays

        List<HospitalStay> getHospitalStays(long patientID,
                                    Date startDate,
                                    Date endDate)
        Returns all HospitalStay object for a given patient and for given period of time.

        A null value for one of the date parameters indicates that the related search criterion will be ignored.

        Parameters:
        patientID - The identifier (objectID) of the object to be fetched. It must be greater than zero (0). It must not be PersistentObject.INVALID_OBJECT_ID
        startDate - The start date of the time period considered for valid hospital stay admission dates during search. Every stay with a admission date after or at this date is considered for the search result. The value may be null. If so, there is no lower bound for admission dates during search.
        endDate - The end date of the time period considered for valid hospital stay discharge dates during search. Every stay with a discharge date before or at this date is considered for the search result. The value may be null. If so, there is no upper bound for valid discharge dates during search.
        Returns:
        A list of matching HospitalStay objects is returned. It may be empty.
        Throws:
        FetchException - Thrown if an error occurred while fetching objects.
        AssertionError - Thrown if a given parameter value is invalid.
        See Also:
        HospitalStay

      • store

        long store(PersistentObject object)
        Persists a given PersistentObject (within a database). Implementations must distinguish between INSERT/UPDATE operations.
        Parameters:
        object - The object to be stored. It must not be null. Has to be persistent (objectID set) in case of a successful store operation.
        Returns:
        The primary key as given by the database system.
        Throws:
        StoreException - Thrown if errors occurred while persisting an object.
        AssertionError - Thrown if a given parameter value is invalid.

      • close

        void close()
        Closes the service and releases all dependent resources. Afterwards the service is unusable.
